[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Account sequence number] During restore, are account sequence numbers validated to be consistent with transaction ordering, or can sequence number violations be restored? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions()] [Database handle safety] Are the Arc<StateStore> and Arc<LedgerDb> handles validated to be from the same database instance, or can cross-database writes occur? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Crypto key validation] For transactions involving cryptographic operations, are public keys and signatures validated during restore, or can invalid crypto data be restored? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions_impl()] [State value size limits] Are there size limits on individual state values in write_sets during restore, or can massive state values cause storage or memory issues? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Genesis state protection] Is there protection preventing restore operations from overwriting or modifying the genesis state and genesis transactions? (Critical)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: confirm_or_save_frozen_subtrees()] [Position overflow] Can Position values overflow or wrap around with large num_leaves values, causing frozen subtrees to be stored at wrong accumulator positions? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Transaction expiration] Are transaction expiration timestamps validated during restore, or can expired transactions be restored that would never execute? (Low)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions_impl()] [State key format] Are state keys validated to follow the correct format (address + type + key structure) during restore, or can malformed keys be inserted? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Consensus round validation] For consensus-related state, is there validation that round numbers, timeouts, and votes are consistent during restore? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: update_latest_ledger_info()] [Version monotonicity] Should there be validation that the new ledger info's version is greater than the current one, not just epoch comparison? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Move resource validation] When restoring Move resources, is there type checking that resources match their declared types in published modules? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions()] [Version collision] If restoring to a database that already has some versions, is there detection of version collisions and appropriate handling? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions_impl()] [Block height validation] For block metadata events at line 250-257, is the block height validated to be sequential and consistent? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Validator reputation] If restoring data containing validator reputation/performance data, is there validation of reputation scores and slashing events? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_ledger_infos()] [Signature weight validation] In LedgerInfoWithSignatures, is there validation that signature weights sum to meet quorum requirements? (Critical)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [State sync coordination] Can restore operations interfere with ongoing state sync operations, causing data races or inconsistent sync state? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions_impl()] [Parallel write conflicts] If save_transactions_impl is called concurrently from multiple threads, can parallel writes to the same batches cause data races? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Disk space validation] Before starting large restore operations, is available disk space validated to ensure completion is possible? (Low)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: confirm_or_save_frozen_subtrees_impl()] [Cryptographic binding] Is there validation that frozen subtree hashes cryptographically bind to the actual transaction content? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Module dependency validation] When restoring Move modules, are dependencies validated to ensure all required modules exist in the restored state? (Medium)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions()] [kv_replay safety] At line 269, the kv_replay parameter controls state calculation - can this flag be manipulated to skip critical state validation? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Recovery point objective] If a restored database is used for consensus, is there validation that the restore point is consistent with other validators' state? (Critical)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_transactions_impl()] [State pruning conflict] If state pruning is enabled, can restoration of old versions conflict with pruning policies, causing unexpected data deletion? (Medium)
[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [System-wide] [Cache invalidation] After restore operations, are relevant in-memory caches invalidated to prevent serving stale data? (High)

[File: storage/aptosdb/src/backup/restore_utils.rs] [Function: save_ledger_infos()] [Consensus state consistency] Are ledger infos validated to be consistent with consensus state (QCs, commits, locks) during restore? (Critical)
